intro: Veratrum lobelianum var. podolicum, commonly known as Podolic white hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, unbranched stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces large, showy white or pale purple flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a waxy coating, while its roots contain toxic alkaloids. This species is often found in moist, calcareous soils in woodlands and meadows.
